items.title: Only 'emph' tag allowed
items.body:
When formatting an entry, I want to use other tags than just 'emph', but then I get messages like:

```
  File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/pybtex_docutils.py", line 57, in format_tag
    tag = self.tags[tag_name]
KeyError: 'b'
```

Looking at the code, it looks like only 'emph' is defined:

```
tags = {
    'emph': docutils.nodes.emphasis,
}
```

How can I define other tags? (in particular, when using the sphinxcontrib.bibtex extension.)

items.title: 'em' tag not defined
items.body:
Somehow `pybtex.richtext` wants an 'em' tag, which is not defined ('emph' is). Any idea why?

Full traceback:


items.title: Can't process .bib file with doi fields
items.body:
We would like doi's rendered in our bibtex output and I see that the latest pybtex supports this. When I pip install pybtex, sphinx-bibtex, and pybtex-docutils from source and run on our docs, I get the following error:

``` python
AssertionError
> /Users/guyer/.virtualenvs/petsc/src/pybtex-docutils/pybtex_docutils.py(61)format_href()
-> assert isinstance(url, basestring)
(Pdb) p url
[u'http://dx.doi.org/', u'10.1146/annurev.matsci.32.101901.155803']
```

I've got:
- Sphinx v1.2b1
- sphinxcontrib-bibtex 0.2.9a1 mcmtroffaes/sphinxcontrib-bibtex@dd2298dd4d
- pybtex-docutils 0.2.1a0 3649b9f771
- pybtex  0.16 http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~ero-sennin/pybtex/trunk/revision/842

FWIW, the .bib entry in question is

``` bibtex
@article{BoettingerReview:2002,
   author =  {W. J. Boettinger and J. A. Warren and C. Beckermann and A.
              Karma},
   title =   {Phase-field simulation of solidification},
   journal = {Annual Review of Materials Research},
   volume =  32,
   year =    2002,
   pages =   {163-194},
   url =     {http://arjournals.annualreviews.org/doi/abs/10.1146/annurev.matsci.32.101901.155803},
   doi =     {10.1146/annurev.matsci.32.101901.155803},
}
```
